abstract: Pres Maithripala Siresena of Sri Lanka, elected to office in January, dissolves Parliament and announces August elections for the 225-member body.
lead_paragraph: President Maithripala Sirisena dissolved the Parliament loyal to his predecessor and called new elections in an attempt to consolidate power and carry out his promise of reforms.

headline.main: Parliament of Sri Lanka Is Dissolved by President
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka’s Leader Pushes to Form a New Parliament

snippet: President Maithripala Sirisena dissolved the Parliament loyal to his predecessor and called new elections in an attempt to consolidate power and carry out his promise of reforms.
